author: CHARLES WHISNAND cwhisnand@portervillerecorder.com
title: County Board again supports Banned Books Week - NewsBreak
text:
Porterville Recorder
website
Tulare County, California
County Board again supports Banned Books Week
By CHARLES WHISNAND cwhisnand@portervillerecorder.com,
12 hours agoThe Tulare County Board of Supervisors again supported Banned Books Week by presenting a proclamation recognizing Banned Books Week which is this week October 5-11. The board presented the proclamation at its meeting on Tuesday. The board has routinely presented a proclamation recognized Banned Books Week for several years now. The proclamation was signed by all five board members: Pete Vander Poel, Dennis Townsend, Amy Shuklian, Larry Micari and Eddie Valero.

Opinion: Why do homeless people frequently disappear?
The author used artificial intelligence in the crafting of this story. Here one day, gone the next. It’s a common reality among people experiencing homelessness. One day the guy in the coffee line at the church just suddenly disappears. He might be gone for a week, a month, a year, or never to be seen again. I often wondered and worried about people who disappeared during homelessness.
